summary:
Sports Pitch Engineering (SPE) specializes in the design and project management of sports field construction.  Sports Pitch Systems (SPS) provides innovative solutions and systems to the sports field construction industry.

SPE & SPS operate in the global market serving clients ranging from athletes to contractors, sports associations to governments and research institutes. In addition to using know-how and experience, SPE is particularly known for its flexibility and quick response time. Our team is able to perform under high pressure and has been involved in the design and construction of fields for major events such as Champions League finals and European, African and World Championships. Flexibility and perseverance are key qualifications for our people. 

Our engineers have been developing hybrid grass systems, whereby natural grass is reinforced with synthetic turf fibers, over the past 15 years . The latest development, "HYBRIGRASS", enables a significant increase in playing capacity whilst, in terms of experience, feels as though the play is on natural grass. 

Please feel free to contact us;

Mobile: +31 (0)6 41717820
Email: rob@sports-pitch-engineering.com & rob@sportspitchsystems.eu
Web: www.sports-pitch-engineering.com & www.sportspitchsystems.eu

projects: [{'title': 'Charlton Athletic FC - Training Ground redevelopment', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Responsible for the design of the pitches and associated infrastructure at the Sparrows Lane Training Ground in London. The scheme comprises of the development of 4no artificial turf pitches and reconstruction of 6no natural grass pitches for the CAFC Academy and professional teams. Furthermore the site will be fitted with a state of the art rain water harvesting system, irrigation lake and high quality irrigation system, reducing the intake of mains water to a minimum.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rob', 'last_name': 'de Heer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sportsfield Design & Construction Engineer'}]}, {'title': 'LKSA Track & Field', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Completion of the new Track and Field construction at Lornah Kiplagat Sports Academy in Iten, Kenya. Responsible for design, project managenent and overall construction supervision.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rob', 'last_name': 'de Heer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sportsfield Design & Construction Engineer'}]}, {'title': 'Hybrid grass systems development', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "From the introduction of the hybrid grass systems at Oxford United's Kassam Stadium in 2001, I have spend years of development and refining these types of products. Hybrid grass systems are defined as fibre reinforced natural grass surfaces whereby artificial fibres provide added strength and stability for the players. The success of hybrid grass systems is not only dictated by the artificial fibre or fibre carrier but moreover depending on the complete package of pitch construction, drainage and irrigation systems and long term pitch maintenance", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rob', 'last_name': 'de Heer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sportsfield Design & Construction Engineer'}]}]
